bobby.engine.bobengine

Class BobView

  • java.lang.Object
    • GLSurfaceView
      • bobby.engine.bobengine.BobView

  • public abstract class BobView
extends GLSurfaceView
    A BobEngine view that contains and renders Rooms with GameObjects. This class should be extended to create custom BobViews that contain Rooms and Graphics.
    Author:
    Ben

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrentRoom

        public Room getCurrentRoom()
        Returns the current room.

      • goToRoom

        public void goToRoom(Room nextRoom)
        Changes the current room to nextRoom.
        Parameters:
        nextRoom - - the room to switch to.

      • getGraphicsHelper

        public GraphicsHelper getGraphicsHelper()
        Returns:
        This BobView's GraphicsHelper

      • setRenderer

        public void setRenderer(Renderer renderer)
        Use a BobRenderer instead.

      • getActivity

        public Activity getActivity()
        Returns the Activity that contains this BobView.

      • getTouch

        public Touch getTouch()
        Returns this BobView's Touch touch listener.

      • getScreenRotation

        public float getScreenRotation()
        Gets the screen orientation.
        Returns:
        Surface.ROTATION_0 for no rotation (portrait)
        Surface.ROTATION_90 for 90 degree rotation (landscape)
        Surface.ROTATION_180 for 180 degree rotation (reverse portrait/upside down portrait)
        Surface.ROTATION_270 for 270 degree rotation (reverse landscape)

      • isPortrait

        public boolean isPortrait()
        Returns true if the oriention is portrait. (Including reverse portrait)

      • isLandscape

        public boolean isLandscape()
        Returns true if the device orientation is landscape.

      • getRatioX

        public double getRatioX()
        Returns the screen width correction ratio for dealing with different size screens. This ratio is based off of the initial orientation of the device when the BobView is initialized!

      • getRatioY

        public double getRatioY()
        Returns the screen height correction ratio for dealing with different size screens. This ratio is based off of the initial orientation of the device when the BobView is initialized!

      • setBackgroundColor

        public void setBackgroundColor(float red,
                               float green,
                               float blue,
                               float alpha)
        Sets the background color for the BobView.
        Parameters:
        red - - Red value from 0 to 1
        green - - Green value from 0 to 1
        blue - - Blue value from 0 to 1
        alpha - - Alpha value from 0 to 1
